Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with water and light, showing it healthy and growing.
The student can draw the same type of plant without water, showing how it looks unhealthy or wilted.
The student can draw the same type of plant without light, showing how it looks unhealthy or wilted.
The student can depict the difference in plant health by comparing a plant with water and light to plants without either water or light.
The student can use these drawings to show understanding that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
CANNOT: The student may have slight inconsistencies in labeling (e.g., omitting labels for 'water' or 'light' in one drawing).
The student might not fully differentiate the appearance of plants lacking water versus those lacking light (e.g., both might look similarly wilted, *(partial understanding of specific effects)*).
